main event: An unidentified flying object was tracked by a ground radar station and visually observed in Tanganyika, East Africa in November or December 1962.
interesting points: The object suddenly turned 90 degrees slightly east, accompanied by a cloud.
The object could not be visually identified, but the turn could not be under control.
The sky was overcast at the time of the sighting.
The sighting was recorded on a Project 10073 Record Card, which was part of the U.S. Air Force's Project Blue Book program that investigated UFOs.
The report includes a conclusion that the object was possibly a balloon.
sighted object: an unidentified object tracked on radar and visually observed
